<JD_START>
Job Title: Children's Campus - Assistant Teacher

Location: Davenport, IA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
Are you passionate about the wonder and curiosity of toddlers? Do you thrive in a nurturing environment where every day brings new adventures in learning? We're looking for a caring and dedicated Assistant Teacher to join our team and support our vibrant 2-year-old program!

At St. Ambrose University Children's Campus, we believe that the early years are crucial for laying the foundation of a child's lifelong love of learning. Our program is designed to spark imagination, promote social-emotional development, and foster a sense of wonder in every child.

Responsibilities: Assist lead teacher in planning and implementing developmentally appropriate activities for 2-year-olds. Create warm, nurturing, and safe environment where children can explore, learn, and grow. Support children in developing important skills such as communication, fine and gross motor skills, and independence Foster positive relationships with children, parents, and colleagues and maintain a clean and organized classroom environment.

Requirements: A two-year Associate Degree in Child Development or related field or a Child Development Associate. Must have ability to communicate effectively with young children and their families. Demonstrate patience, flexibility, and a positive attitude. Have the ability to work collaboratively n a team environment.

Benefits: Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid holidays, PTO and tuition remission. Opportunities for professional development, and training. Access to campus amenities, cultural events, and recreational facilities.

St. Ambrose is an independent, comprehensive, and Catholic diocesan university firmly founded in the liberal arts and is committed to fostering a respectful environment that recognizes and embraces diversity among all students, faculty, and staff. As an equal opportunity institution, St. Ambrose actively seeks applications from members of underrepresented groups.

If you are ready to embark on a rewarding journey with our 2-year-old program and make a positive impact on the lives of young child, we'd love to hear from you. Please apply online at https://stambroseuniv.applicantlist.com and upload a cover letter, resume and contact information of three professional references. Position is open until filled. EOE

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
